review: Got this for my mother who wants to get away from cable (she is paying ~$180/month). She doesn't know a lot about computers, so I had to set this up for her, and spend ~ an hour teaching her how to use it. She will be cancelling her cable tv soon, saving over $100/month (she signed up for netflix/prime/hulu already, after a short trial).Using a smart phone with this really makes the mic'd remote unnecessary, so don't worry about getting it if you have a decent phone. If you don't have a decent phone, the upgraded remote might be worth it due to the terrible on-screen typing system that *everyone* uses =P
author: Steven Worcester

review: At first impression - I LOVED the new Fire TV Stick.But, it has lost its luster after "forgetting" my login info many times, including the login info for the Wifi network - VERY ANNOYING!I have mainly switched back to using my CAT5 Wired Apple TV because there are no issues with "buffering" when you are on a hard wired cable.

review: This has been a great investment for us.  We had found our on demand feature from our cable company's upgraded box extremely hard to navigate through, so we would give up trying to find the shows our kids wanted to watch.  The Fire Stick has given us and them so many more options now, and it is so easy to use!
